intro: Sterigmapetalum chrysophyllum, commonly known as the golden star flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling stars. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough, hairy texture. The botanical features of Sterigmapetalum chrysophyllum make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
